title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Wednesday, 9 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: northamptonshire police has confirmed it will not be investigating undeclared payments made to the local party of mp david mackintosh .
kettering borough council will tonight consider a proposal to host the final stage of next year 's aviva women 's tour .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for northamptonshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel .

documents.title: christmas lights extravaganza in wellingborough
text: as festive lights go , karl beetson from wellingborough 's efforts will take some beating .
speaking to me earlier , he said : `` we start putting them up over the first weekend in october to get them all ready for the switch on at the end of november . ''
he added : `` there 's probably about 50,000 individual bulbs , and its certainly popular .
we had 150 people turn up to watch the switch on . ''
karl 's annual christmas lights display on torrington road in wellingborough raises money for jdrf , the world 's leading charitable funder of type 1 diabetes research .
the 2015 display raising awareness and funds for @ twitterid @ twitterid we have just giving setup @
author: Annabel Amos
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: county council budget proposals : authorities need to work better together
text: northamptonshire 's eight main councils could save £ 80m per year if they worked better together , according to the leader of the county council .
conservative councillor jim harker said : `` it 's the public 's money , it 's not my money . ''
the authority 's draft budget contains a plan for a 'combined authority ' - a legal agreement with borough and district councils - that would save £ 4.5m .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby development : new tenant `` ca n't believe '' her luck
text: one of the first new council house tenants at the regenerated canada square in corby is nicole ogilvy .
she 's moved in wither young son after being in rented accommodation .

nicole told me she could n't believe her luck in getting the house after being on the waiting list : `` it 's so nice to be in a new build because no one else has lived in it before , it 's all fresh and painted ; it 's lovely . ''
eighteen council houses and 18 affordable homes are being built there .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants bus routes 'will be largely unaffected ' by proposed cuts
text: the managing director of the county 's biggest bus operator says a proposal by northamptonshire county council to cut £ 200,000 from bus subsidies next year should n't affect the majority of bus routes and users in the county .
steve burd from stagecoach said : `` we will work very closely with the county council to ensure the impact is minimised where possible . ''
he added : `` we have just under 200 vehicles running in northamptonshire and effectively only three are funded by northamptonshire county council . ''
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton business welcomes expected drop in fuel prices
text: a distribution company based in northampton is welcoming a predicted drop in fuel prices this side of christmas .
the rac thinks the price of petrol and diesel will drop to below a pound of litre in the next couple of weeks .
craig minney , from efm distribution in northampton , said : `` fuel prices make a significant difference to our business , it 's been a tough few years .
fuel is easily our biggest outlay . ''
author: Annabel Amos
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: trading standards warning over skin lightening creams
text: trading standards officers in northamptonshire are warning people to be cautious after skin lightening products on sale in the county were found to contain a banned substance .
the cosmetics included the ingredient hydroquinone , a substance banned from being supplied over the counter in such products .
the products also failed to have information on their packaging about where they are from , as required by european law .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: flore bypass : link road crucial for county economy
text: the new a45 daventry link road is hugely important to the northamptonshire economy , according to the chief operating officer of northamptonshire enterprise partnership .
sajeeda rose said : this project is hugely important , not only to local communities who have been campaigning a long time for the development , but to the northamptonshire economy as a whole . ''
the new three-and-a-half mile single carriageway intends to improve transport links between northampton and daventry , and relieve the amount of traffic through flore , weedon and upper heyford .
northamptonshire enterprise partnership is investing £ 14m towards the total building cost of £ 32m .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: latest headlines : first sod of new flore bypass cut reaction to county council budget cut proposals
text: here are the latest headlines for northamptonshire this afternoon :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: home made pesto courtesy of northampton food writer
text: northampton food writer carmelo sereno hayes showed me how to make home made pesto on bbc radio northampton last night .
you can do the same - watch a sped up version on how she did it here .
i can confirm it tasted as delicious as it looked .
thanks to the fantastic @ twitterid for this week 's # onepotwonder with @ twitterid here 's what she made .
@ twitterid @ twitterid look @ twitterid x
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid mmm looked yummy ! !
! xx
author: Rob Adcock
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: gayton conservation area reviewed
text: residents in and around gayton are being asked for their views on revising the area 's existing conservation area .
the current review by south northamptonshire council proposes to increase the boundary of the area to include additional buildings - and remove the middle section of baker street .
the village 's conservation area was first designated in 1984 , and reviewed again in 2004 .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby development : government needs to support council to build new homes
text: the labour leader of corby borough council is calling on the government to do more to help councils build new council houses .
tom beattie was speaking at the regenerated canada square area of kingswood , corby .
eighteen council houses and 18 affordable homes are being built .
he told me : `` the government really needs to grasp the nettle in terms of support for councils like corby in building houses like this . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: peter pan production will be a charity hit
text: a kettering theatre group is raising money for two good causes during its christmas pantomime peter pan .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: corby development : 36 new homes in kingswood area
text: the latest stage of the redevelopment of canada square in the kingswood area of corby has taken place this afternoon .
eighteen council houses and a further 18 affordable homes are being built .
for the first time , corby borough council will manage the affordable homes on behalf of the housing association .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire veteran awarded french legion d'honneur
text: a former garage owner has been awarded the french legion d'honneur for his role in the second world war .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: winter skies over the grand union
text: kyle holmes emailed us this beautiful shot of winter skies over the grand union canal between stoke bruerne and grafton regis .
we love receiving your contributions , do send us yours .

documents.title: twenty-four hour rowing marathon set to raise money for charity
text: members of the university of northampton 's rowing club are holding a 24-hour rowing marathon today to raise money for northampton hope centre .
the group of 30 students will be taking it in turns on rowing machines in the grosvenor centre in northampton - and hope to raise £ 5,000 .
from 18:00 the rowers will relocate to the university 's park campus for the night shift .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kettering 's james acaster to visit twin town in germany after successful funding bid for youtube series
text: comedian james acaster is to explore kettering 's links with its twin town lahnstein after a bid to make a follow-up series of his popular youtube series proved successful .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: northampton woman named care home worker of the year
text: a northampton care home worker has won a regional award for her work .
sally harris works with residents who have brain injuries and very complex needs at christchurch view neurological rehabilitation centre in abington , northampton .
she was named care home worker of the year in the east midlands regional great british care awards .
author: Anna Bartlett
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: flore bypass : hard hats in full effect
text: work on the long awaited a45 daventry link road began today .
the officialdom may be over , but the hard hats remain
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: flore bypass : the moment work started on the a45 daventry link road
text: a sod cutting ceremony officially marking the start of building work for the new a45 daventry link road took place this morning .
reporter martin heath captured the moment

documents.title: flore bypass : spades enter the ground
text: work on the a45 daventry link road started today , with an official sod cutting ceremony taking place at 11:30 .
northamptonshire county council chief executive paul blantern tweetedthis from the event
paul blantern
rosasignum
@ twitterid @ twitterid working with @ twitterid to start the flore weedon bypass

documents.title: flore bypass : sod cutting ceremony
text: a ceremony officially marking the start of building work for the new a45 daventry link road took place this morning .
the new road will take two years to build and will divert traffic around the villages of upper heyford , flore and weedon .
daventry district council leader , chris millar , and leader of northamptonshire county council , jim harker , were joined by long running campaigners from flore , duncan shepherd and wendy amos .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: new bypass ends years of campaigning by residents
text: many of the most determined campaigners for the so-called flore/weedon bypass have n't lived to see their dream come true , but some of their successors were there to see the first sod turned on the route .
the journey to this point has n't been an easy one - finding funding for the £ 35m project has been difficult and there have been problems with the route as well .
there has been some opposition to the plan , notably from local businesses who 'll lose passing trade .
but it 's now all systems go for the three-and-a-half mile road .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: women 's tour 2016 could return to northamptonshire
text: tonight , kettering borough council 's executive will be presented with six options about hosting the final stage of next year 's aviva women 's tour .
the council estimates it would need to contribute £ 40,000 towards the event , which might be the sticking point .
the hope is the final stage might start in northampton and end in kettering .
the six options range from agreeing to stage the event to refusing it outright .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: latest news : work on long awaited a45 daventry link road begins women 's tour could finish in kettering
text: these are northamptonshire 's headlines this lunchtime :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: runner to complete 100th marathon in 100 days in northampton
text: a runner will complete his 100th marathon in 100 days in northampton to highlight the type of bullying that led him to two suicide attempts .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: women 's tour : northamptonshire could host final stage
text: kettering borough council will tonight consider a request from northamptonshire county council to host the final stage of next year 's aviva women 's tour .
it 's likely to take place on 19 june .
councillors will be told the final stage might start in northampton and finish in kettering..
it 'll attract a lot of attention from cycling fans and the sporting media .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: new bypass for flore and weedon
text: campaigners in the villages of flore and weedon are celebrating today , as work on the a45 daventry link road finally gets under way .
sue butler , chairwoman of weedon parish council , told bbc radio northampton 's stuart linnell that the a45 is `` complete mayhem '' on some days .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kettering could host final stage of women 's tour cycle race
text: plans to host next year 's final stage of the aviva women 's tour cycle race in kettering will be discussed this evening .
stages of the professional race have been held in northamptonshire over the last two years , but this would be the first time the final stage of the final day is held in the county .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: buyers at proposed northampton housing estate advised not to open windows because of m1 noise
text: owners of some homes at a proposed housing estate near northampton have been advised not to open their windows because of noise from the m1 .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: flore bypass `` will make a great difference '' for the village
text: building work on a bypass for the villages of flore and weedon - which people have actively campaigned for since the 1970s - gets under way today .
the a45 daventry link road should take two years to complete , and will divert traffic away from upper heyford , flore and weedon .
duncan shepherd , from flore , said : `` it should join the two parts of the villager together as the north side has always been separated from the south .
it will make a great difference . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: police 'not investigating ' mp payments
text: northamptonshire police has confirmed it `` will not be investigating '' undeclared payments made to the local party of mp david mackintosh .
last month it was revealed the local conservatives received £ 6,195 and £ 10,000 from different businessmen .
we 're hoping to hear a response from the electoral commission soon .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: where does the new bypass go ?
text: officially called the a45 daventry link road , the new road , which you can see below marked in black , will take traffic northwards away from nether heyford , flore and weedon .
do you live in the area ?
what difference will the bypass make ?
join the discussion on facebook and we 'll feature the best comments during the day .

documents.title: record-breaking year as wellingborough poppy appeal raises £ 47,000
text: people in wellingborough have helped fundraisers make it a record-breaking year for the town 's poppy appeal .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: diamonds win sees them go top while kettering lose
text: in division one central , afc rushden and diamonds beat hanwell town 2-1 last night - putting them top of the league on 40 points .
in other news , kettering town suffered a 1-0 defeat at cirencester in the southern league premier division , ending their four match unbeaten run .
the league table tonight
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: new trust to run children 's services will mean big savings , conservatives claim
text: a new trust set up to run children 's services in the county will mean big savings , according to the ruling conservative group on northamptonshire county council .
a decision to speed up the creation of the `` arms-length '' company was announced as part of the authority 's draft budget for next year - which includes £ 77m worth of cuts to services .
children 's services will see its budget rise slightly , but increased demand means the department must save £ 20m .

documents.title: bypass work begins after decades of residents campaigning
text: following decades of residents campaigning , work is finally starting today on a new bypass between northampton and daventry .
one of the county 's busiest roads - the a45 - will be diverted away from villages including flore and weedon .
the first sod will be turned on the new route at 11:30 .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: £ 77m savings plans will not be realised , claim labour
text: `` misleading and unrealistic '' plans to save £ 77m from northamptonshire county council 's budget next year will never be realised , labour 's opposition leader has claimed .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: weather : windy day in northamptonshire
text: it will be a very windy day with gales possible across high ground by the afternoon .
most places will stay dry with some bright or sunny intervals but cloud will increase through the afternoon .
maximum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: latest news : work begins on bypass between northampton and daventry conservatives claim new trust set up to run children 's services will save money
text: your news headlines this morning :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: welcome to northamptonshire live
text: good morning all and welcome to wednesday 's coverage .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates for northamptonshire .
we 'd love to feature your stories , comments and get in touch with us at any time via email , facebook or twitter .
this morning 's news headlines coming right up .
author: David Keller
BBC News
